page.title: 01Shawforth - Introduction
page.content: Shawforth is a part of the Township of Whitworth and nestles in a valley five miles north of Rochdale on the A671 Rochdale to Burnley road. Past industrial quarry and coal mine workings are much in evidence, but once up on the surrounding moors the wild landscape takes on a beauty of its own. Two miles to the south is Healey Dell Nature Reserve, well worth a visit. The area is well situated for day trips to North Wales, the Lake District, the Yorkshire Dales,the Peak District and seaside resorts such as Southport, Morecambe and Blackpool. For those who prefer the city scene, Manchester and Liverpool are both within an hour's travelling time, thanks to an extensive motorway system close at hand.
